title: Our annual mock draft with 32 first-round trades: Deals for Kirk Cousins, Micah Parsons
content: We proposed 32 trades to shake up Round 1, including deals that involve Falcons QB Kirk Cousins and Cowboys edge Micah Parsons.

title: Stanford hires Reich as interim head coach for '25
content: Stanford has hired veteran NFL coach Frank Reich as the interim HC for the 2025 season. He last coached the Carolina Panthers in 2023 and has a 41-43-1 record.

title: Titans' Callahan: Franchise QBs are 'priceless'
content: The Tennessee Titans say they're "two weeks away-ish" from deciding on the first pick of the 2025 NFL draft and are still looking at quarterback prospects including Shedeur Sanders and Cam Ward. The Titans also said trading the No. 1 pick is an option.

title: Ohio State lands 4-star safety Bradford in upset
content: Ohio State landed a significant recruiting upset in the 2026 class on Monday, edging LSU and Texas to secure the commitment of four-star safety Blaine Bradford, No. 32 in the ESPN Junior 300.

title: Source: Tush push ban has support in committee
content: At the league meetings this week in West Palm Beach, Florida, a source with direct knowledge told ESPN that the Green Bay Packers' proposal to ban the push sneak, popularly known as the tush push, has support within the NFL's competition committee.

title: Ravens have internally discussed Lamar extension
content: The Ravens have had internal conversations about a new deal for two-time NFL Most Valuable Player Lamar Jackson, coach John Harbaugh said Monday.

title: Glenn says Jets' new silent approach 'by design'
content: The Jets are making a concerted effort to turn down the volume now that Aaron Rodgers is gone, coach Aaron Glenn says.

title: 7 ejected after skirmish between Pistons, Wolves
content: Five players and two coaches were ejected after a fight broke out in the second quarter of the Timberwolves' 123-104 win against the Pistons on Sunday.

title: Tomlin 'comfortable' with Rudolph as starting QB
content: Mike Tomlin is "comfortable" with the idea of Mason Rudolph as the starting quarterback, the Steelers head coach said from the annual league meetings Monday morning.

title: What is a torpedo bat? How much does it help hitters? Inside MLB's next big thing
content: After the Yankees' home run barrage with bats that look like bowling pins, the innovation is sweeping baseball.

title: Men's Final Four predictions, previews for Auburn-Florida, Duke-Houston
content: Here's how each 1-seed reached San Antonio and their key to reaching the final, plus disagreement on one game.

title: Can a JuJu-less USC do it again? Is UConn ready to win it all? Previewing an Elite Eight showdown
content: It's not the superstar matchup fans expected. But the stakes of Monday's UConn-USC game are still sky high.

title: After painful Olympics, Jordan Chiles is 'That Girl' leading UCLA to NCAAs
content: Chiles always knew she could help the Bruins win an NCAA title, but she didn't know how much they would help her heal.

title: Playoff positioning to tanking teams: What to watch the rest of the NBA regular season
content: Our NBA insiders break down six things to keep your eye on in the last two weeks of the NBA regular season.

title: NHL playoff watch: The Stars' path to the Central title
content: Dallas will need some help, but Winnipeg is vulnerable. Plus, projections for the entire playoff bracket.

title: Letting Salah leave for free could be one of Liverpool's biggest mistakes ever
content: Every time Mohamed Salah scores, he gets closer to Erling Haaland's record, and Liverpool's failure to hand him a new contract looks even more reckless.

title: Haaland injured as Man City reach FA Cup semis
content: Erling Haaland was substituted with a left ankle injury in the 60th minute of Manchester City's FA Cup quarterfinal match against Bournemouth on Sunday.

title: Flick feeling 'love' as Barca hit 4 goals for 20th time
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick said he loves his team's thirst for goals after they scored four more against Girona on Sunday to restore their three point lead at the top of LaLiga.

title: América, LAFC could play for CWC spot, FIFA says
content: FIFA has drawn up plans to hold a one-game playoff between Club América and Los Angeles Football Club to determine a replacement team for Club León at the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN.

title: Football Australia: 'No further action' on Kerr
content: Sam Kerr has avoided being stripped of the Matildas captaincy after meeting with the Football Australia board, with the striker finally joining the Australian women's team in camp.

title: Cunha on Wolves future: 'Need to take next step'
content: Wolves forward Matheus Cunha has said that he is keen to leave the club this summer, saying he has "made it clear that I need to take the next step."

title: Rashford: First Villa goals mark steady progress
content: Marcus Rashford has pointed to his "step by step" progress since joining Aston Villa after he scored his first goals for the club on Sunday.

title: Messi's Miami on top, Sporting KC rock bottom
content: A 35-minute cameo from Leo Messi was all Inter Miami needed to show why they are clear atop ESPN's MLS Power Rankings. Sporting KC's season, meanwhile, went from bad to worse.

title: European soccer review: Barcelona extend unbeaten run to 20
content: Barcelona continue to cruise under manager Hansi Flick and towards the LaLiga title. That and more from around the continent in ESPN's Weekend Review.

title: Forecasting next season for women's eliminated top seeds
content: NC State has been eliminated. From portal priorities to incoming recruits, we look ahead to the Wolfpack next season.

title: Can Arsenal, Man United make a title race after Chelsea stumble?
content: Catch up on the action from the women's game as Chelsea's slip-up has given Arsenal and Man United unexpected hope of a late-season WSL title chase.

title: Can U.S. figure skating carry this momentum to the Olympics?
content: With less than a year until the Olympics, the world titles from Ilia Malinin, Alysa Liu and Madison Chock and Evan Bates have even more weight.

title: Justine Siegal will go to bat for women in pro baseball once more as WPBL co-founder
content: As part of Women's History Month, ESPN examines WPBL co-founder Justine Siegal's lifelong dedication to women's baseball.

title: Denny Hamlin gets first win at Martinsville in 10 years
content: Denny Hamlin ended an agonizing 10-year winless streak at Martinsville Speedway, holding off teammate Christopher Bell in his home state.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern Munich's Thomas Müller has offers from MLS
content: Thomas Müller, a two-time Champions League winner, could be the next star to move to MLS. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Mayer and Price are the best welterweights; now they need to fight
content: After anther victory, the only thing between Mikaela Mayer and the undisputed championship is Lauren Price.

title: HAL Didn't Transfer Sensitive Tech To Russia: Sources On NYT Report
content: ANew York Times report wrongly claimed thatHindustan Aeronautics Limited - a government-owned aerospace and defence company - sold sensitive technology, with potential military use, to a blacklisted agency supplying Russia with weapons.

title: Car Driven By 15-Year-Old Crushes Toddler, Delhi Family's Eid Turns Tragic
content: Eid excitement at a Delhi home turned to mourning after their two-year-old daughter was crushed to death while she was playing on the street outside their home. The Hyundai Venue car was driven by a 15-year-old.

title: India, US To Jointly Design, Manufacture Nuclear Reactors In India
content: In a landmark moment for the India-US civil nuclear deal, which was signed two decades ago, the US' Department of Energy or DoE has given the final approval permitting a US company to jointly design and build nuclear power plants in India.

title: 'Going To An Address Where...': Kunal Kamra's Swipe As Cops Visit Mumbai Home
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra on Monday took a swipe at the Mumbai Police, asking them not to "waste time" and "public resources".

title: "Unnecessary": RSS Leader On Controversy Over Aurangzeb's Tomb
content: The controversy over the tomb of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb is "unnecessary", said Suresh "Bhaiyyaji" Joshi, senior leader of the BJP's ideological mentor Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh today.

title: Filmmaker, Who Offered Role To Viral Kumbh Girl Monalisa, Arrested For Rape
content: Sanoj Mishra, the director who offered viral sensation Monalisa a role in his film during the Kumbh Mela, has been arrested in connection with a rape case.

title: 4 Chinese Men Try To "Remove" Documents From Bangkok Collapse Site, Detained
content: Police in Thailand detained four Chinese nationals on Sunday for unlawfully entering the site of an under-construction building that collapsed after a powerful earthquake in Chatuchak District last week.

title: Live: Number Of Deaths Rises To 2,056 In Myanmar, 270 Still Missing
content: The ruling junta in Myanmar on Monday declared a week of national mourning for the devastating earthquake, which has killed more than 1,700 people so far.

title: IPL LIVE: Uncapped MI Gem Gets 4 Wickets On IPL Debut; KKR 9-Down
content: Mumbai Indians vs Kolkata Knight Riders LIVE Score, IPL 2025 LIVE: 23-year-old MI pacer Ashwani Kumar dismissed KKR stars Ajinkya Rahane, Rinku Singh, Manish Pandey and Andre Russell on IPL debut.

title: Jaish And Lashkar Rift Widens, India Reworks Strategy Amid Changed Dynamics
content: Pakistani state actors are pushing battle-hardened terrorists of the Jaish-e-Mohammed into India from several areas in Jammu and Kashmir, sources told NDTV.

title: Nidhi Tewari, IFS Officer From PM's Constituency, His New Private Secretary
content: Nidhi Tewari, a 2014-batch officer of the Indian Foreign Service, will take over as the next private secretary of  Prime Minister Narendra Modi. She is currently serving as the Deputy Secretary in the Prime Minister's Office or PMO

title: Bumrah "On Borderline Of A Fracture": BCCI Sent 'You Can't Do That' Message
content: Jasprit Bumrah missed the India vs England series, the Champions Trophy and there is still no clarity on when he will be back in IPL 2025 for Mumbai Indians

title: "Our Father...": D Fadnavis Snaps At Sanjay Raut For PM 'Retirement' Talk
content: There is no chance that Prime Minister Modi will retire in September, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said Monday, amid buzz over the BJP's 'unspoken rule' about 75 being the retirement age.

title: Opinion: Turkey: History Comes Back To Bite Erdogan
content: In 1998, while still mayor of Istanbul, Erdogan was arrested on charges of inciting racial hatred and spent four months in jail. His arrest only made him more popular and brought him to the national stage.

title: Donald Trump Says US Will Tariff The Entire World, "Let's See What Happens"
content: Donald Trump declared that he will tariff the entire world, as US gears up for what he has called "Liberation Day" on April 2. His announcement came aboard the Air Force One. In the coming days, we would impose tariffs on "all countries," he said.

title: He Spotted Faulty Pillar Before Bangkok Building Collapse: Victim's Partner
content: On Monday, rescuers were desperately searching for 76 people feared trapped under the rubble of the unfinished tower in Chatuchak district of Bangkok.

title: Telangana begins rice export to South East Asia from Kakinada Anchorage Port
content: Telangana Minister for Civil supplies N. Uttam Kumar Reddy flags off first rice consignment to the Philippines as part G2G deal on Monday

title: Pawan Kalyan is putting special focus on development of North Andhra, says Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar
content: ‘The Deputy Chief Minister is keen on initiating a skill development programme to suit the needs of the industry in the region’

title: Union Minister Pemmmasani assures resolution of BSNL service disruptions
content: He contacted BSNL Chief General Manager Seshachalam over the phone and sought an explanation regarding the issues raised by TIP operators, including persistent disruptions in BSNL’s broadband services, speed issues, transmission interruptions, and billing problems

title: Government organ transplant and retrieval centre to be established in Bengaluru
content: ₹ 1 crore sanctioned for facility development and establishment, steps taken to construct a helipad at Victoria Hospital for seamless organ transportation.

title: Will put pressure on Centre against Waqf Amendment Bill: Abdul Azeez
content: We have already discussed about the Waqf Amendment Bill with Chief Minister and we will speak to him once again, says A.P. Waqf Board Chairman

title: Muslims offer mass Id prayers in several districts
content: Festivities mark the conclusion of Ramzan fasting month as Muslims offer namaz at various idgah maidans in Dharwad, Haveri, Gadag, Uttara Kannada and Davangere

title: Bengal BJP accuses Mamata of insulting Hindu religion during Id celebrations
content: Addressing a gathering in Kolkata, the Chief Minister said, ‘I don’t support the (Ganda Dharm - dirty religion) which this jumla party had created’

title: A.P. government committed to development of minorities, say ministers
content: In the latest Budget, ₹5,434 crore has been allocated for minority welfare and ₹14 crore for Haj pilgrimage, says Social Welfare Minister Dola Sree Bala Veeranjaneya Swamy

title: Modern slaughterhouse to open in capital city within a month
content: The city Corporation’s slaughterhouse at Kunnukuzhy was closed in February 2013 as it failed to manage the waste generated in a scientific way. In the absence of a slaughterhouse, illegal abattoirs have flourished across the city

title: Traitor jibe at Shinde: Mumbai cops reach Kunal Kamra's Mahim home as he fails to appear
content: Responding to the news, Mr. Kamra took to the social media platform X and called Mumbai cops’ efforts a “waste of time and public resources”

title: Prayers, silent protests mark Eid-ul-Fitr celebrations in Vijayawada
content: Many arrive for Eid prayers sporting black ribbons as per call given by All India Muslim Personal Law Board as a protest against the Waqf (Amendment) Bill

title: Faced with flak, tourism and civic agencies attempt to restore Fort Kochi beach to its past glory
content: Corporation mulls a floating boom barrier that protrudes into the sea to prevent the deposit of trash and seaweed on the beach, says Mayor M. Anilkumar

title: CBCI appeals to political parties to adopt an unbiased approach towards Waqf Bill
content: It says certain provisions in the existing Central Waqf Act are inconsistent with the Constitution. The rightful ownership of land must be fully restored to the people of Munambam, the forum adds

title: Kodandarama taken out on palanquin, rides Garuda on fifth day of Brahmotsavams
content: The temple is also gearing up for the annual ‘Srirama Navami’ festivities which will be held from April 6 to 8

title: Customised circuits planned to boost tourism potential of Kozhikode
content: A waterway will be constructed from Elathur to Kadalundi, connecting various rivers and canals. Circuit stations will be set up at Beypore, Kothi, Kallai, Sarovaram Biopark, Elathur, and Korapuzha, where water taxi services will be available

title: M.P. govt ‘lied’ about no hike in taxes during Budget, says Congress
content: Party leader Patwari points to the iminent rise in power tariff and the likely increase in property rates and taxes as proof of the government’s ‘lies’

title: CPI casts doubt on Tharoor’s political loyalties following Congress leader’s praise of Modi’s global health diplomacy during COVID-19
content: In an article published in an English news weekly on the eve of the fifth anniversary of the national lockdown, Mr Tharoor projected the Central government’s decision to supply two major COVID-19 vaccines produced in the country to 100 nations as a master stroke of global health diplomacy.

title: 2.65 lakh beneficiaries to receive NTR Bharosa pensions in Chittoor district
content: 100 per cent of the pension disbursement must be completed on the opening day without any delay, says Collector

title: Trial run of portable traffic control light successful in Kozhikode
content: The product was brought to the city after a successful trial run by Nagpur police; the solar-powered unit costs around ₹2.10 lakh

title: Former PCCF appeals to CM to stop grant of swampy grasslands in Nagarahole core area to claimants
content: Former forest official B.K. Singh any such action will lead to serious human-wildlife conflict in Virajpet taluk

title: Delhi HC relief to HIV-positive men in promotion, appointment in paramilitary forces
content: The High Court mandates reasonable accommodation for HIV-positive individuals in employment, protecting against discrimination

title: Vijayawada roundtable calls for special Assembly session, all-party meet on delimitation
content: Speakers urge the Chief Minister to pass a resolution on the issue after holding a thorough debate and send it to the Centre; Andhra Pradesh, along with other Southern States, would lose Lok Sabha seats if the proposed delimitation is implemented, they warn; roundtable calls upon TDP, JSP, and YSRCP to attend the upcoming  conference on delimitation in Hyderabad

title: Purno Sangma advocated divisive ideas in northeast: Former Manipur CM
content: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K. Sangma said it was unfortunate that Nongthombam Biren Singh dragged the name of his father

title: Pay more for milk, electricity, toll and new solid waste cess from today
content: With multiple cost increases coming into effect simultaneously, the financial burden on consumers is expected to rise significantly impacting household budgets across Karnataka.

title: Despite ‘voluntary cuts,’ Empuraan makers continue to face the heat
content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) State vice-president B. Gopalakrishnan stirred up a controversy after he called film producer Supriya Menon, filmmaker Prithviraj’s spouse, an “urban naxal.”

title: Jagan condemns ‘murder’ of YSRCP worker in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: The former Chief Minister alleges deterioration of law and order in Andhra Pradesh and blames the TDP for it

title: Lowering tariff will harm farmers: Samyukt Kisan Morcha
content: The farmers’ body said it would strongly respond to efforts to open the Indian market to products from the United States

title: CNG to cost more after govt hikes APM gas price by 4%
content: This is the first increase in the APM gas price in two years and in accordance with the roadmap that was laid out by the government

title: Congress eyes revival in Srikakulam, seeks candidate names for ZPTC, MPTC polls
content: Congress leader Ambati Krishnarao vows party revival in Srikakulam, focusing on local issues and selecting candidates for ZPTC and MPTC polls

title: A.P. government committed to welfare of minorities, says Minister
content: Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy asks Hindus and Muslims to uphold their spirit of brotherhood and maintain Rayachoti’s ageless reputation for communal peace and harmony

title: Illegal parking at Bengaluru bus stops continues with over 23,000 cases booked in three years
content: Regular commuters say that the illegal occupation of bus stops forces BMTC buses to stop in the middle of the road, delaying traffic and creating safety hazards

title: Orthodox Church welcomes Jacobite Catholicos’ call for discussions
content: Church says the first step toward peace is recognising and abiding by the country’s legal framework. It adds that if Catholicos’ words are sincere peace will prevail in Malankara Church.

title: Union Bank of India’s Regional Office inaugurated in Hubballi
content: It was inaugurated by Managing Director of Swarnaa Group of Companies V.S.V. Prasad in the virtual presence of the bank’s Zonal Head Navneet Kumar

title: Ministers flag off two APSRTC buses from Repalle to Tirupati
content: Revenue Minister Anagani assures that road infrastructure projects were under way in the constituency as promised and that 16,000 teacher posts will soon be filled through the DSC recruitment

title: A rice deal that secured the shelter of Nilgiri tahrs in Munnar
content: March 31 marks half a century since the declaration of the Eravikulam-Rajamala Wildlife Sanctuary, which later became the Eravikulam National Park

title: Aided college teachers in Calicut varsity flag delay in promotions
content: At least 213 promotion files have been pending with the university for some time, says a member of the advisory committee of the Senate standing committee for private college staff

title: Centre has approved 50 surface minor irrigation projects for Dharwad, says Joshi
content: Union Jal Shakti Minister C.R. Patil has given the nod for works in about 2,244 hectares of land under the Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayi Yojana

title: Steps in place to provide water to livestock, says A.P. Transport Minister
content: Government sanctions as many as 1,115 water troughs in Annamayya district, and as part of the project, Mandipalli Ramprasad Redd formally launches three troughs at Kondavandlapalle village

title: CPI(M) workers display pictures of murder convicts during temple festival in Kannur
content: Flags featuring pictures of eight persons sentenced to life in the Sooraj murder case allegedly used in procession during temple festival

title: Rajgir to host men’s Asia Cup, Hockey India signs MoU with Bihar Sports Authority
content: Bihar’s historical city Rajgir was awarded the hosting rights following a successful conduct of women’s Asian Champions Trophy

title: Cultivate horticulture crops in unused lands: Nandyal Collector
content: Nearly two lakh acres of land is being used for cultivation for only three months during the end of kharif season, says Rajakumari Ganiya

title: BJP seeks to put Congress in a political quandary over the Waqf Bill and Munambam land issues
content: BJP has signalled that it would make the contentious issues major talking points in the run-up to the Assembly elections 2026, chiefly as a touchstone of Congress’s commitment to its Christian base, including its Kerala Congress allies.

title: Police shoot robber in the leg as he tries to flee in Gadag district
content: He was among three members of a gang arrested by the police and being taken to Laxmeshwar Police Station when the incident happened

title: Ban on late-night functioning of shops in force on Kovoor-Iringadanpally road
content: The restriction follows strong protests from residents, who alleged that drug peddlers were frequenting the area late at night and using such shops, mainly wayside eateries, as their business hub due to the absence of enforcement drives

title: Revised State old age and transgender policies to be published soon: R. Bindu
content: Kerala State Elderly Commission to be formed in a month; plan to provide domiciliary care to all bedridden old people

title: Chiguru Chinmaya Award conferred on six young achievers
content: Quality education and strong moral values play a vital role in building a healthy nation, says Rangayana Director in Kalaburagi

title: Christians hold rally in Kakinada seeking justice for pastor
content: Hundreds join peace rally in Kakinada demanding fair probe into pastor Praveen Kumar’s death, State government urged to hold transparent probe

title: New sweet potato variety developed by ICAR-CTCRI to strengthen tribal food security programmes
content: The biofortified orange-fleshed sweet potato has undergone final trials successfully in multiple States, including Odisha, West Bengal, Karnataka and Kerala

title: SLBC tunnel rescue teams working to extent conveyor belt by 100 meters
content: Work on to trace the mortal remains of the six persons buried under the debris in the tunnel collapse that happened on February 22

title: Nirmala Sitharaman to visit London from April 8-10; FTA talks may figure in meetings
content: Ms. Sitharaman is likely to hold a bilateral meeting with U.K.'s Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves and other British ministers

title: Union Minister Pemmamsani offers Eid prayers in Guntur
content: The holy month of Ramadan teaches us how to keep negative traits such as anger, arrogance, and selfishness at bay. It is a time of reflection, discipline, and compassion, which can inspire individuals to lead more meaningful and harmonious lives, he says

title: Himachal University’s Institute of Legal Studies bags first position in State-level moot court competition
content: Presided over by senior advocates and legal luminaries, the competition drew law students from across the State

title: Collection of parking fee in shopping mall is unfair: Chennai consumer court
content: The Consumer District Redressal Forum, Chennai (North) has directed V.R. Mall in Thirumangalam to immediatey discontinue the practice of imposing parking fees on customers

title: PUCL condemns communal violence in Nagpur, seeks impartial inquiry
content: The recent violence in Nagpur was preceded by hate speeches and calls to violence by political leaders, Ministers and extremist groups on the issue of Aurangzeb’s tomb in Khuldabad, the People’s Union for Civil Liberties said

title: On cam: Two-yr-old girl crushed under car being driven by teen in Delhi
content: A family's Eid celebration in Delhi turned tragic when their two-year-old daughter was fatally hit by a car driven by a neighbor's teenage son in Paharganj. The incident, captured on CCTV, showed the child being run over as the car moved forward hesitantly. The toddler was pronounced dead at a nearby medical facility.

title: How to create Ghibli style art using Google Gemini for free
content: Ghibli style art has surged on social media, with users turning personal photos into the beloved aesthetic of Hayao Miyazaki's films using Google Gemini's AI. The process involves uploading a photo, crafting detailed prompts, and refining the generated image. This trend blends cutting-edge technology with the whimsical charm of Studio Ghibli's dreamy visuals.

title: Who is Ashwani Kumar? MI's debutant who took a wicket on first ball
content: Ashwani Kumar, a left-arm pacer for Mumbai Indians, had a memorable IPL debut by taking a wicket with his first ball against Kolkata Knight Riders. His breakthrough came with a spectacular catch by Tilak Varma. This early strike helped Mumbai Indians dominate the game. Ashwani, from Punjab, impressed in his eagerly anticipated debut.

title: Pakistan suffers deadliest Ramzan in a decade
content: During Ramzan, Pakistan saw its highest number of militant attacks in a decade, totaling 84 incidents compared to 26 last year, as reported by think tanks. The escalation follows the Pakistani Taliban's ceasefire withdrawal and the Baloch Liberation Army's increased activities.

title: Eid Mubarak 2025: 75+ Happy Eid-ul-Fitr messages, greetings, wishes and quotes
content: Eid-ul-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan and is celebrated by Muslims through prayer, charity, and feasting. Celebrations include wearing new clothes, family gatherings, special foods, and giving gifts to children. The festival symbolizes faith, purity, and togetherness and will be observed from March 31 to April 1, 2025, based on moon sighting.

title: Explained: How ChatGPT is creating Ghibli style images
content: ChatGPT's new image generation feature has gone viral, enabling users to create art in the distinctive Studio Ghibli style. This updated AI tool, powered by GPT-4o, generates detailed images pixel by pixel, sparking debate about AI's role in creative processes and intellectual property rights.

title: 'Factually incorrect, misleading': India rejects NYT report on HAL
content: The ministry of external affairs in India has rejected a report by The New York Times as factually incorrect and misleading. The report alleged that Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) engaged in questionable transactions involving restricted technology with Russia, which the ministry denied, emphasizing India's compliance with strategic trade laws.

title: Rocket Companies to acquire Mr Cooper in $9.4 billion all-stock deal
content: Rocket Mortgage is set to acquire Mr. Cooper in an all-stock deal valued at $9.4 billion, soon after acquiring Redfin. The merger will handle one in six US mortgages, adding 7 million clients to Rocket's portfolio. Jay Bray will become President and CEO of the combined company, expected to boost loan volumes and reduce customer acquisition costs.

title: Ghibli style image: Step-by-step guide to turn your Ghibli photos into video
content: Social media is currently abuzz with Ghibli-style photo trends, featuring dreamy, pastel images. Utilizing AI tools and hand-drawn art, creators are now turning these into animation videos. This guide explains the step-by-step process to produce your own Ghibli-inspired short animation.

title: ECB to 'retire' Pataudi Trophy: What’s next for ENG-IND series?
content: The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) is considering discontinuing the MAK Pataudi Trophy for England-India Test series starting in 2025. Speculations suggest a new trophy may honor more recent cricketing icons, though the ECB has yet to confirm any official changes. A source close to the family mentioned, "That is the understanding from the ECB. Apparently, trophies are retired after some time."

title: Trump's crackdown on pro-Palestinian protests: Who are the int students
content: Several international students in the U.S. face arrests and deportation for participating in pro-Palestinian protests and allegedly supporting Hamas. Notable cases include Tufts University's Rumeysa Ozturk, Columbia's Mahmoud Khalil, and Georgetown's Badar Khan Suri. Each faces legal battles amid accusations, with varied backgrounds and alleged activities.

title: Beyond 'Dirty 15': Trump says 'Liberation Day' tariffs to hit all countries
content: US President Donald Trump has announced that new reciprocal tariffs will affect all countries globally, rather than just 10-15 with major trade deficits. These tariffs aim to protect the domestic economy and secure better terms for the United States.

title: Why Harry-Meghan are being called royal bullies
content: Sophie Chandauka, chair of Sentebale, has accused Prince Harry of causing significant damage to the charity's reputation and fundraising efforts. She claims Harry's actions since Megxit have been problematic, leading to a decline in donor support. Meghan Markle is also mentioned in relation to disruptions at a charity event. Their future and brand appear uncertain.

title: 'Kaun sa dharm ganda hai?': BJP flays Mamata over 'provocative speech'
content: West Bengal BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari accused Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee of delivering a provocative speech during Eid-ul-Fitr celebrations at Red Road. He claimed Banerjee made controversial remarks and tried to incite community animosity. BJP criticized her for allegedly deriding Hindu faith and politics at a religious event.

title: IPL 2025: Why is Jasprit Bumrah not playing MI vs KKR today?
content: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah will miss Mumbai Indians' first home IPL 2025 game against Kolkata Knight Riders. Having been out since January, Bumrah is undergoing rehabilitation with no confirmed return date. Mumbai Indians have lost their initial matches, and Bumrah's absence has been pivotal in their slow start to the season.

title: WWE RAW: Full match card, highlights, how to watch, and more
content: Monday Night RAW features Cody Rhodes and John Cena before their WrestleMania 41 clash, with IYO SKY taking on Rhea Ripley for the Women's World Championship with Bianca Belair as the special referee. Jimmy Uso faces Gunther, and Logan Paul challenges AJ Styles. Catch the action live from London on various broadcasting platforms.

title: Primark CEO resigns following investigation into behaviour toward woman
content: Paul Marchant, CEO of Primark, has resigned following an investigation into inappropriate behavior toward a woman. Apologizing for his actions, he stepped down immediately, prompting a 4.9% drop in shares of parent company ABF. Eoin Tonge has been appointed interim CEO. Primark commits to maintaining a respectful work environment and high standards of integrity.

title: Who is Nidhi Tewari? newly appointed private secretary to PM Modi
content: Nidhi Tewari, a 2014-batch IFS officer, has been appointed as the private secretary to Prime Minister Narendra Modi. She is currently serving as deputy secretary in the PMO. Tewari hails from Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, and joined the Prime Minister's Office as Under Secretary in 2022. Her appointment has been approved by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet.

title: 'Topic of Aurangzeb's tomb has been raised unnecessarily': RSS leader
content: Senior RSS leader Suresh 'Bhaiyyaji' Joshi dismissed the controversy over Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb, stating it is unnecessary. He emphasized India's inclusiveness, referencing Shivaji Maharaj's historical actions. Raj Thackeray and other leaders echoed these sentiments, advising against interpreting historical events through religious lenses and cautioning against misinformation spreading on platforms like WhatsApp.

title: 'Bihar being shamed': RJD on Nitish Kumar's 'objectionable' act on stage
content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar faced backlash from RJD after a video showed him placing his arm around a woman's shoulder during an event with Union home minister Amit Shah. RJD criticized his behavior as objectionable and questioned his ability to govern due to alleged health issues.

title: 'Fight Trump’s Gaza plan with bullets, stones': Hamas gives global call
content: A senior Hamas leader urged global supporters to take action against President Donald Trump's proposal to relocate over two million Gazans to neighbouring countries. Trump suggested redeveloping Gaza while relocating its residents, but Palestinian leaders and the international community condemned the plan, citing potential chaos in the region.

title: Threatening to bomb Iran to anger at Putin: Top statements by Trump this week
content: US President Donald Trump issued threats to Iran about potential bombing and secondary tariffs over the nuclear deal and expressed his frustration with Putin regarding the Ukraine crisis. He also signaled his interest in acquiring Greenland, praised Indian PM Modi, and hinted at a possible third presidential term.

title: Noida Lamborghini accident: Accused driver Deepak granted bail
content: Deepak, the driver involved in the Noida Lamborghini accident, received bail from Surajpur District Court. The incident, occurring near Sector 94 roundabout, injured two Chhattisgarh labourers due to a claimed vehicle fault. A video captured post-accident questioning. Police seized the Puducherry-registered car and are investigating further, with the injured now out of danger.

title: Riyan Parag takes selfie with ground staff, then tosses phone away - WATCH
content: Rajasthan Royals secured their first win of IPL 2025 by defeating Chennai Super Kings. Stand-in captain Riyan Parag, who faced backlash for his post-match behavior and was fined for slow over-rate, led the team in Sanju Samson's absence. Fans criticized Parag's actions after the victory. After losing their season opener to Sunrisers Hyderabad, Rajasthan Royals will next take on Punjab Kings in Mullanpur on April 5.

title: 'RSS will pick PM Modi's successor,' says Raut; CM Fadnavis reacts
content: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut claimed that PM Narendra Modi's successor would be from Maharashtra and decided by the RSS. Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis countered, asserting Modi would continue as PM until 2029. The speculation arose following Modi's visit to the RSS headquarters. Fadnavis emphasized discussing succession while Modi is still active is inappropriate.

title: Waqf Bill row: Rijiju accuses oppn of lying, misleading public
content: Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju condemns opposition groups for allegedly misleading people about the Waqf Amendment Bill. He urges all political parties to participate in parliamentary debates and discussions on the bill. Meanwhile, protests against the bill continue, with demonstrators wearing black armbands during prayers.

title: 'He doesn't have to spoon-feed me': Varun on understanding with Narine
content: Varun Chakaravarthy credits Sunil Narine for shaping his career, highlighting their strong on-field understanding. He stresses sticking to basics in high-pressure situations. A key bowler for KKR, Chakaravarthy aims to dismiss top Indian batters like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in IPL 2025. Fresh from India's Champions Trophy win, he remains focused on continuous improvement.

title: Kunal Kamra will be given 'Shiv Sena-style' welcome, says Rahool Kanal
content: Yuva Sena’s Rahool Kanal warned comedian Kunal Kamra of a 'Shiv Sena-style' welcome in Mumbai. Kamra has anticipatory bail from Madras high court after multiple FIRs over a satirical video targeting Maharashtra deputy chief minister Eknath Shinde. Despite opposition support and anticipatory bail, Kamra faces significant legal and political pressure.

title: France's far-right leader Le Pen barred from holding office for 5 years
content: A French court has banned Marine Le Pen from running for office after convicting her of embezzling public funds via fake jobs at the European Parliament. This decision prevents her from contesting the 2027 presidential election and could reshape France’s political landscape. Le Pen, along with National Rally members, was found guilty of misusing EU funds.

title: Renault Group to buy out Nissan’s 51% stake in India arm RNAIPL
content: Renault Group will acquire Nissan's 51% stake in their joint venture in India, Renault Nissan Automotive India Pvt Ltd, becoming the sole owner. This move will enhance Renault's international presence, while Nissan remains committed to the Indian market with new SUVs and continuing its operations in India

title: Musk says he might go to Mars 'but that will be part of America'
content: Elon Musk emphasiSed his commitment to the United States at a Wisconsin rally, saying he will stay in America even in tough times and support president Donald Trump’s agenda, while also expressing his Mars vision. The rally, held before Wisconsin’s Supreme Court election, highlighted the impact of potential redistricting on legislative reforms.

title: Taylor and Kelce’s relationship might face challenges. But why?
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's relationship continues despite former President Donald Trump's predicted breakup. The couple faces tension as the Kansas City Chiefs plan a White House visit under Trump's invitation, amidst his ongoing feud with Swift. Fans await the release date of Swift's new album and Kelce's retirement confirmation.

title: Sanju Samson seeks BCCI clearance to keep wickets in IPL
content: Sanju Samson has approached the BCCI Centre of Excellence for full clearance to resume wicket-keeping duties following surgery on his index finger. With partial clearance, he played merely as a batter while Riyan Parag captained Rajasthan Royals in IPL 2025. A positive evaluation can reinstate Samson's captaincy. Rajasthan Royals' upcoming schedule includes an away clash against Punjab Kings on April 5, followed by a fixture against Gujarat Titans in Ahmedabad on April 9.

title: 'Bid to make Prithviraj scapegoat': Director's mother on L2 Empuraan row
content: Prithviraj Sukumaran's mother, Mallika, defends her son against allegations of misleading Mohanlal and producers for the film 'L2: Empuraan'. She clarifies all decisions were collaborative, with full awareness of involved parties. Mohanlal acknowledged the film's contentious themes and committed to revisions. Despite criticism, 'L2: Empuraan' achieved box office success, grossing Rs 80 crore worldwide in its opening weekend.

title: Lamborghini involved in Noida crash belongs to YouTuber with 18.7m followers
content: A Lamborghini test-driven by Deepak Kumar, a car dealer from Ajmer, crashed in Noida Sector 94. Two construction workers were injured. The car is owned by YouTuber Mridul. Police have charged Deepak with rash driving. The incident caused outrage due to Deepak's nonchalant response. The vehicle has been seized by the police.

title: Pat Cummins reveals an 'ideal' Australian vacation for Virat Kohli
content: Australian cricket captain Pat Cummins, currently in India for the IPL, calls the country his second home and praises its culture and energy. As a Tourism Australia advocate, he is promoting Australia to Indian fans. He also shared ideas for an ideal Australian vacation for Virat Kohli and addressed media scrutiny in his role.

title: Hyderabad University stir: Students detained as bulldozers roll in
content: Dozens of University of Hyderabad students were detained by Cyberabad police after protesting against land clearing near Mushroom Rock. Students claimed police arrested them arbitrarily and stormed academic spaces. Four earth movers were deployed with heavy police presence. Police shifted the protesters to different stations and may file criminal cases against some students. Police have increased security.

title: Rahul Gandhi writes letter to PM Modi to cancel offshore mining tenders
content: Rahul Gandhi urges Prime Minister Modi to cancel offshore mining tenders along the coasts of Kerala, Gujarat, and Andaman & Nicobar, citing environmental threats and impacts on livelihoods. He calls for thorough impact assessments and stakeholder consultations before any major decisions are made.

title: Munawar Faruqui requests Meerut police to reconsider the Eid Namaz ban
content: Comedian Munawar Faruqui called on Meerut Police to reconsider its decision against offering namaz on streets, stressing that festivals are often celebrated in public spaces. He pointed out similar practices in Mumbai and the historical significance of such freedoms. Faruqui urged peaceful coexistence while also advising Muslims to respect public spaces.

title: 'Only 40% recovered': Not paying traffic fines could get driving licence suspended
content: Drivers who fail to pay their traffic e-challan fines within three months may face suspension of their driving licenses. Additionally, accumulating three challans for serious offenses in a financial year could result in a three-month license confiscation. This measure is aimed at improving the current low recovery rate of fines and ensuring better compliance with traffic laws.

title: 'US will receive a blow': Iran warns of 'strong' response if attacked
content: Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei warned the US of a strong retaliation if President Trump's threats of bombing are executed due to Iran's non-compliance with a new nuclear deal. This follows Trump's ultimatum and warnings of severe consequences, including unprecedented bombing and secondary tariffs on Iran. Tensions heighten as both nations stand firm on their positions regarding the nuclear agreement.

title: Aurangzeb's tomb protected monument but won't allow glorification: Maha CM
content: Maharashtra chief minister Devendra Fadnavis has dismissed calls for the removal of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb, citing its status as a protected monument while opposing glorification of the emperor. Union minister Ramdas Athawale has suggested replacing the tomb with a memorial for Chhatrapati Sambhaji. Tensions have escalated, with protests by right-wing groups and violent clashes reported.

title: Why kids, young mothers are leaving men behind in Uttarakhand's border villages
content: In Uttarakashi's high-altitude villages near the India-China border, young women and children are migrating to towns due to inadequate local school facilities. Despite economic prosperity from apple farming and tourism, men stay back to manage businesses, leading to family separations.

title: Arsenal name Berta as new sporting director
content: Andrea Berta will take on the permanent role, replacing Edu Gasper . Berta has been on a six-month period of gardening leave since resigning in November . he is looking forward to playing his part in shaping a successful future with the club .

title: Bernardo: Winning FA Cup won't redeem season
content: man city beat Bournemouth 2-1 in the quarterfinals of the FA Cup . city secured their place in the semifinals on Sunday after a comeback 2-1 win . the hosts took the lead through Evanlison after Erling Haaland missed a penalty earlier in the half .

title: Countdown to 894: The Alex Ovechkin goal-scoring tracker
content: Alex Ovechkin broke 800-goal barrier during 2022-23 season . he now has 890 goals and is one of the NHL's most popular bets . the date when Ovi eclipses Gretzky depends on his goal-scoring pace .
